cv.name: CellOntology
cv.description: The Cell Ontology is designed as a structured controlled vocabulary for cell types

cv.name: UBERON
cv.description: Uberon is an integrated cross-species anatomy ontology representing a variety of entities classified according to traditional anatomical criteria such as structure, function and developmental lineage.

cv.name: ISO3166
cv.description: ISO 3166 is the International Standard for country codes and codes for their subdivisions. The purpose of ISO 3166 is to establish internationally recognised codes for the representation of names of countries, territories or areas of geographical interest, and their subdivisions. A complementary classification, related to ISO 3166 is UN M.49 (Standard Country and Area Codes Classifications)

term-alias.name: ALIAS:EAL
term-alias.description: East Anglia: United Kingdom region composed of the administrative counties of Norfolk to the north, Suffolk to the south, Cambridgeshire and Essex to the west.

cv.name: strand
cv.e: Reverse strand
Forward strand

cv.name: validationStatus
cv.e: Not valid
Not tested
Validated

cv.name: junctionType
cv.e: Canonical
Non-canonical

cv.name: sex
cv.e: male
female

cv.name: wgbsFeatures
cv.e: The type of sonicator used for extraction.
The number of sonication cycles used for extraction.
The initial DNA quantity used in preparation.
The DNA fragment size range used in preparation.
The sequence of the adaptor used in preparation.
The protocol used for adaptor ligation.
The fragment size selection after adaptor ligation.
The bisulfite conversion protocol.
The bisulfite conversion percent and how it was determined.
The PCR template concentration for library generation.
The PCR polymerase used for library generation
The thermocycling program used for library generation.
The number of PCR cycles used for library generation.
The sequence of the PCR forward primer used for library generation.
The sequence of the PCR reverse primer used for library generation.
The concentration of the PCR primers used for library generation.
The protocol for isolating PCR products used for library generation.

cv.name: medipFeatures
cv.e: The type of sonicator used for extraction.
The number of sonication cycles used for extraction.
The MeDIP protocol used.
The amount of DNA used in the MeDIP protocol.
The type of bead used in the MeDIP protocol.
The amount of beads used in the MeDIP protocol.
The amount of antibody used in the MeDIP protocol.
The specific antibody used in the MeDIP protocol.
The name of the company, laboratory or person that provided the antibody.
The catalog from which the antibody was purchased.
The lot identifier of the antibody.

cv.name: mreFeatures
cv.e: The MRE protocol.
The amount of chromatin used in the MRE protocol.
The restriction enzyme(s) used in the MRE protocol.
The size of the fragments selected in the MRE protocol.

cv.name: csiFeatures
cv.e: The type of sonicator used for extraction.
The number of sonication cycles used for extraction.
Input
The amount of chromatin used in the ChIP protocol.

cv.name: csFeatures
cv.e: The type of sonicator used for extraction.
The number of sonication cycles used for extraction.
The ChIP protocol used.
The amount of chromatin used in the ChIP protocol.
The type of bead used in the ChIP protocol.
The amount of beads used in the ChIP protocol.
The amount of antibody used in the ChIP protocol.
The specific antibody used in the ChIP protocol.
The name of the company, laboratory or person that provided the antibody.
The catalog from which the antibody was purchased.
The lot identifier of the antibody.
The timespan in which the chromatin is crosslinked
The fragment size range of the preparation.

cv.name: mrnaFeatures
cv.e: The mRNA enrichment method used in the extraction protocol.
The fragmentation method used in the extraction protocol.
The initial mRNA quantity used in preparation.
The mRNA fragment size range of the preparation.
The sequence of the 5' RNA adapter used in preparation.
The sequence of the 3' RNA adapter used in preparation.
The sequence of the primer for reverse transcription used in preparation.
The protocol for 5' dephosphorylation used in preparation.
The protocol for 5' phosphorylation used in preparation.
The protocol for 3' adapter ligation used in preparation.
The protocol for 5' adapter ligation used in preparation.
The protocol for reverse transcription used in preparation.
The PCR template concentration for library generation.
The PCR polymerase used for library generation
The thermocycling program used for library generation.
The number of PCR cycles used for library generation.
The sequence of the PCR forward primer used for library generation.
The sequence of the PCR reverse primer used for library generation.
The concentration of the PCR primers used for library generation.
The protocol for isolating PCR products used for library generation.
mRNA or cDNA - The type of template.
True or False - Is the sample amplified?
The initial mRNA quantity used in preparation.
The protocol for reverse transcription used in preparation.
The number of PCR cycles used to amplify.
The protocol used to generate the library.
The fragmentation method used in the library protocol.
The fragment size range of the preparation.
The sequence of the 3' adapter used for library generation.
The sequence of the 5' adapter used for library generation.

cv.name: smrnaFeatures
cv.e: The smRNA enrichment method used in the extraction protocol.
The initial smRNA quantity used in preparation.
The sequence of the 5' RNA adapter used in preparation.
The sequence of the 3' RNA adapter used in preparation.
The sequence of the primer for reverse transcription used in preparation.
The protocol for 3' adapter ligation used in preparation.
The protocol for 5' adapter ligation used in preparation.
The protocol for reverse transcription used in preparation.
The PCR template concentration for library generation.
The PCR polymerase used for library generation
The thermocycling program used for library generation.
The number of PCR cycles used for library generation.
The sequence of the PCR forward primer used for library generation.
The sequence of the PCR reverse primer used for library generation.
The concentration of the PCR primers used for library generation.
The protocol for isolating PCR products used for library generation.

cv.name: SRALibraryStrategy
cv.description: Sequencing technique intended for this library (borrowed from SRA XML 1.2).
cv.e: Random sequencing of the whole genome.
Random sequencing of exonic regions selected from the genome.
Random sequencing of whole transcriptome.
Random sequencing of a whole chromosome or other replicon isolated from a genome.
Genomic clone based (hierarchical) sequencing.
Shotgun of pooled clones (usually BACs and Fosmids).
Sequencing of overlapping or distinct PCR or RT-PCR products.
DEPRECATED. Sequencing of overlapping or distinct products that have been tagged with a short identifying sequence (barcode). Each sequence read can therefore be assigned to an individual product.
Clone end (5', 3', or both) sequencing.
Sequencing intended to finish (close) gaps in existing coverage.
Direct sequencing of chromatin immunoprecipitates.
Direct sequencing following MNase digestion.
Sequencing of hypersensitive sites, or segments of open chromatin that are more readily cleaved by DNaseI.
Sequencing following treatment of DNA with bisulfite to convert cytosine residues to uracil depending on methylation status.
Single pass sequencing of cDNA templates
Full-length sequencing of cDNA templates
Concatenated Tag Sequencing
Methylation-Sensitive Restriction Enzyme Sequencing strategy.
Methylated DNA Immunoprecipitation Sequencing strategy.
Direct sequencing of methylated fractions sequencing strategy.
Library strategy not listed.

null-values.e: Data not supplied at this time (for future fill)
Not applicable for the context of the surrounding knowledge
Data verified to be unknown (void, undef, null)
Data derived from other field or default value

column.name: name
column.description: The algorithm name

column.name: url
column.description: The URL which describes it

column.name: notes
column.description: Any additional non-identifying information can be included here.

column.name: experiment_id
column.description: Unique identifier for the experiment performed on a sample

column.name: experiment_type
column.description: The type of experiment, from the point of view of IHEC (it is later subclassified)
column.annotation: It corresponds with IHEC Level 0 EXPERIMENT_TYPE (Chromatin Accessibility, WGBS, MeDIP-Seq, MRE-Seq, Chip-Seq Input, Chip-Seq, mRNA-seq, smRNA-Seq)

column.name: library_strategy
column.description: The type of experiment, from the point of view of EGA/SRA (it is later subclassified)
column.annotation: It corresponds with /EXPERIMENT_SET/EXPERIMENT/DESIGN/LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR/LIBRARY_STRATEGY , from EGA/SRA 1.2 metadata

column.name: experimental_group_id
column.description: Identifier of the experimental group who did the experiment

column.name: features
column.description: The known features/experimental conditions about the experiment

column.name: feature
column.description: The name of the feature

column.name: value
column.description: The measure associated to the feature

column.name: units
column.description: The units of the measure

column.name: raw_data_repository
column.description: Public repository where raw data is submitted (#)

column.name: raw_data_accession
column.description: Accession and URL for referencing the raw data at the public repository

column.name: accession
column.description: Raw data accession number

column.name: url
column.description: Public entry of the raw data

column.name: platform
column.description: Platform or technology used in the detection phase

column.name: seq_coverage
column.description: Sequence coverage if analyzed by sequencing platforms

column.name: extraction_protocol
column.description: The protocol used to isolate the extracted material
column.annotation: It corresponds with IHEC Level 0 EXTRACTION_PROTOCOL (Chromatin Accessibility, WGBS, MeDIP-Seq, Chip-Seq Input, Chip-Seq, mRNA-seq, smRNA-Seq)

column.name: analysis_id
column.description: Unique identifier for the analysis performed for a particular set of samples

column.name: analysis_group_id
column.description: Identifier of the analysis group (i.e. the one who prepared/run the pipeline)

column.name: data_status
column.description: The status of the analysis over the associated raw data

cv.e: Withdrawn
Only raw data available
Raw data available (analysis in process)
Raw and analysis data available (analysis finished)

column.name: assembly_version
column.description: Version of reference genome assembly

column.name: ensembl_version
column.description: Version of Ensembl

column.name: gencode_version
column.description: Version of Gencode

column.name: program_versions
column.description: The versions of (some of) the programs used for the analysis

column.name: program
column.description: The pipeline or program name

column.name: version
column.description: The used version or release

column.name: alignment_algorithm
column.description: Name of alignment algorithm and URL to written protocol

column.name: other_analysis_algorithm
column.description: Names of other analysis algorithms. Separate multiple algorithms by commas.

column.name: notes
column.description: Optional field to leave notes

column.name: gene_build_version
column.description: Version of Ensembl gene build used for annotation (or the version of Ensembl gene build integrated into used GENCODE build)

column.name: normalization_algorithm
column.description: Name of normalization algorithm and URL to written protocol

column.name: chromosome
column.description: Name of the chromosome containing the experimentally detected feature (mutation, variation, expression, ...)

column.name: chromosome_start
column.description: Start position of the mutation/variation on the chromosome

column.name: chromosome_end
column.description: End position of the mutation/variation on the chromosome

column.name: chromosome_strand
column.description: Strand where it was detected the mutation/variation on the chromosome

column.name: notes
column.description: Optional field to leave notes

column.name: quality_score
column.description: Average quality score for the mutation/variation call

column.name: probability
column.description: Probability of the mutation/variation call

column.name: biological_validation
column.description: Was there some kind of biological validation?

column.name: status
column.description: Indicate if the mutation/variation has been observed in a larger cohort/sample size, and is not an artifact or consequence of sample selection for sequencing

column.name: platform
column.description: Identifier of assay platform or technology used to validate the mutation/variant

column.name: normalized_read_count
column.description: Normalized count of sequencing reads if analyzed by sequencing platforms

column.name: raw_read_count
column.description: Raw count of sequencing reads if analyzed by sequencing platforms

column.name: total_reads
column.description: Total number of reads over this position/segment, either identifying or not a cytosine, for sequencing platforms. Mean reads depth for other technologies

column.name: c_total_reads
column.description: Reads which has identified this position as a cytosine

column.name: d_lated_reads
column.description: Reads which has identified this position as a DNA *lated cytosine

column.name: quality_score
column.description: Quality score for the DNA *-lation call

column.name: probability
column.description: Probability of the DNA *-lation call

column.name: d_lated_fragment_id
column.description: Unique identifier for the methylated fragment, in the form d'*lationType|chromosome_chromosomeStart_chromosomeEnd

column.name: rank
column.description: Kind of used ranking and its value, in the form "rank:value". As it can hold more than one value, they are separated by semicolons

column.name: rank
column.description: Ranking criteria

column.name: value
column.description: Value calculated using the ranking criteria

column.name: ensembl_version
column.description: Version of Ensembl gene build used for annotation (or the version of Ensembl gene build integrated into used GENCODE build)

column.name: gene_affected
column.description: Gene affected. Use Ensembl gene id, separated by | when there is more than one. If no gene is affected, don't put an entry

column.name: notes
column.description: Optional field to leave notes

concept.name: donor
concept.description: This submission file describes a donor from which one or more specimens were obtained.

column.name: donor_id
column.description: Unique identifier for the donor; assigned by data provider.
column.annotation: It corresponds with IHEC Level 0 DONOR_ID (Primary Cell, Primary Cell Culture & Primary Tissue)

column.name: donor_sex
column.description: Donor biological sex.
column.annotation: It corresponds with IHEC Level 0 SEX (Cell Line) and DONOR_SEX (Primary Cell, Primary Cell Culture & Primary Tissue)

column.name: donor_region_of_residence
column.description: Country, and optionally state or province code, but not city.
column.annotation: ISO3166-1-alpha-2 or ISO3166-2 codes, eg: "CA" or "CA-ON"

column.name: donor_ethnicity
column.description: Donor ethnicity, from LOINC (subset ethnicity)
column.annotation: It corresponds with IHEC Level 0 DONOR_ETHNICITY (Primary Cell, Primary Cell Culture & Primary Tissue)

concept.name: specimen
concept.description: This submission file describes a specimen from which one or more samples were derived. Use additional rows for more than one specimen from the same patient. If more than one specimen was extracted during the same procedure, each gets a distinct ID.

column.name: specimen_id
column.description: Unique identifier for the specimen assigned by data provider.

column.name: tissue_type
column.description: Free text description of site where the specimen was taken.
column.annotation: It corresponds to IHEC Level 0 TISSUE_TYPE (Primary Tissue)

column.name: tissue_depot
column.description: Details about the anatomical location from which the specimen was collected
column.annotation: It corresponds to IHEC Level 0 TISSUE_DEPOT (Primary Tissue)

column.name: specimen_term
column.description: Term from UBERON or EFO ontologies which identifies the tissue (or the place where the specimen was taken)
column.annotation: It maps IHEC Level 0 TISSUE_TYPE and IHEC Level 0 TISSUE_DEPOT (both from Primary Tissue) to UBERON or EFO ontologies

column.name: collection_method
column.description: The protocol followed to collect the specimen
column.annotation: It corresponds to IHEC Level 0 COLLECTION_METHOD (Primary Tissue)

column.name: donor_min_age_at_specimen_acquisition
column.description: Donor minimal age when the specimen was acquired, in ISO-8601 duration (basic format)
column.annotation: It corresponds with IHEC Level 0 DONOR_AGE (Primary Cell, Primary Cell Culture & Primary Tissue), which contains the minimal age

column.name: donor_max_age_at_specimen_acquisition
column.description: Donor max age when the specimen was acquired.
column.annotation: It corresponds with IHEC Level 0 DONOR_AGE (Primary Cell, Primary Cell Culture & Primary Tissue), which contains the maximal age

column.name: donor_health_status
column.description: The donor health status at specimen acquisition (when available)
column.annotation: It corresponds with IHEC Level 0 DONOR_HEALTH_STATUS (Primary Cell, Primary Cell Culture & Primary Tissue)

column.name: donor_disease
column.description: If the donor was ill, the EFO code (browsable here) or SNOMED-CT code (from Disease branch) of the disease at acquisition time. Use code EFO_0000761 when the donor was healthy
column.annotation: This value can come from EGA Phenotype field. When this field and donor_disease_text are set, the description of the term in this field should be used

column.name: donor_disease_text
column.description: If the donor was ill, the disease name at acquisition time.
column.annotation: It corresponds to IHEC Level 0 DISEASE (Cell Line, Primary Cell, Primary Cell Culture & Primary Tissue). When it is possible, use donor_disease field

column.name: specimen_processing
column.description: Description of technique used to process specimen

cv.e: cryopreservation in liquid nitrogen (dead tissue)
cryopreservation in dry ice (dead tissue)
cryopreservation of live cells in liquid nitrogen
cryopreservation, other
formalin fixed, unbuffered
formalin fixed, buffered
formalin fixed & paraffin embedded
fresh
other technique

column.name: specimen_processing_other
column.description: If "other" specified for specimen_processing, may indicate technique here.

column.name: specimen_storage
column.description: Description of how specimen was stored. For specimens that were extracted freshly or immediately cultured, answer (1) "NA".

cv.e: frozen, liquid nitrogen
frozen, -70 freezer
frozen, vapor phase
RNA later frozen
paraffin block
cut slide
other

column.name: specimen_storage_other
column.description: If "other" specified for specimen_storage, may indicate technique here.

column.name: specimen_biomaterial_provider
column.description: If the specimen was obtained from a biobank, provide the biobank name here
column.annotation: It corresponds with IHEC Level 0 BIOMATERIAL_PROVIDER (Cell Line, Primary Cell, Primary Cell Culture & Primary Tissue)

column.name: specimen_biomaterial_id
column.description: If the specimen was obtained from a biobank, provide the biobank accession number here.

column.name: specimen_available
column.description: Whether additional tissue is available for followup studies.

concept.name: sample
concept.description: This submission file describes an analyzed sample on which molecular characterization was performed. It includes both control samples (from healthy people) and samples from ill people.

column.name: sample_id
column.description: Unique identifier for the sample assigned by data provider

column.name: purified_cell_type
column.description: Purified cell type for the sample
column.annotation: It corresponds more or less with IHEC Level 0 CELL_TYPE (Primary Cell & Primary Cell Culture)

column.name: culture_conditions
column.description: The conditions under which the primary cell was cultured
column.annotation: It corresponds with IHEC Level 0 CULTURE_CONDITIONS (Primary Cell Culture)

column.name: markers
column.description: Markers used to isolate and identify the cell type
column.annotation: It corresponds with IHEC Level 0 MARKERS (Primary Cell & Primary Cell Culture)

column.name: analyzed_sample_type
column.description: Controlled vocabulary description of sample type

cv.e: Normal blood
Leukemic blood
Normal control adjacent to primary
Normal control from non-tumour site
Control from cell line derived from normal tissue
Normal mouse host
Primary tumour
Mouse xenograft derived from tumour
Cell line derived from tumour
Cell line derived from xenograft
Other (specify)

column.name: analyzed_sample_type_other
column.description: Free text description of site of sample if "other" was specified in analyzed_sample_type field

column.name: analyzed_sample_interval
column.description: Interval from specimen acquisition to sample use in an analytic procedure (e.g. DNA extraction), in days

concept-domain.description: These concepts are based on Version 1.1 of IHEC Metadata (July 3rd, 2013)

column.name: experiment_type
column.description: Type of experiment: Chromatin Accessibility
column.annotation: It corresponds with IHEC Level 0 EXPERIMENT_TYPE (Chromatin Accessibility)

column.name: library_strategy
column.description: The library strategy, from the point of view of EGA/SRA
column.annotation: It corresponds with /EXPERIMENT_SET/EXPERIMENT/DESIGN/LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR/LIBRARY_STRATEGY , from EGA/SRA 1.2 metadata

column.name: features
column.description: The known features/experimental conditions about the Chromatin Accessibility experiment

column.description: The feature name

cv.e: Protocol used for DNAse treatment

column.name: value
column.description: The value assigned to this feature

column.name: units
column.description: The units of the value assigned to this feature

column.name: experiment_type
column.description: Type of experiment: DNA Methylation
column.annotation: It corresponds with IHEC Level 0 EXPERIMENT_TYPE (WGBS)

column.name: library_strategy

column.annotation: It corresponds with /EXPERIMENT_SET/EXPERIMENT/DESIGN/LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR/LIBRARY_STRATEGY , from EGA/SRA 1.2 metadata

column.annotation: It corresponds with IHEC Level 0 EXPERIMENT_TYPE (MeDIP-Seq)

column.name: library_strategy
column.description: The library strategy, from the point of view of EGA/SRA
column.annotation: It corresponds with /EXPERIMENT_SET/EXPERIMENT/DESIGN/LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR/LIBRARY_STRATEGY , from EGA/SRA 1.2 metadata

column.description: The known features/experimental conditions about the MeDIP-Seq experiment

column.description: The feature name

column.name: value
column.description: The value assigned to this feature

column.description: The units of the value assigned to this feature

column.description: Type of experiment: DNA Methylation
column.annotation: It corresponds with IHEC Level 0 EXPERIMENT_TYPE (MRE-Seq)

column.name: library_strategy
column.description: The library strategy, from the point of view of EGA/SRA
column.annotation: It corresponds with /EXPERIMENT_SET/EXPERIMENT/DESIGN/LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR/LIBRARY_STRATEGY , from EGA/SRA 1.2 metadata

column.name: features
column.description: The known features/experimental conditions about the MRE-Seq experiment

column.name: feature
column.description: The feature name

column.name: value
column.description: The value assigned to this feature

column.name: units
column.description: The units of the value assigned to this feature

column.name: experiment_type
column.description: Type of experiment: ChIP-Seq Input
column.annotation: It corresponds with IHEC Level 0 EXPERIMENT_TYPE (Chip-Seq Input)

column.name: library_strategy
column.description: The library strategy, from the point of view of EGA/SRA
column.annotation: It corresponds with /EXPERIMENT_SET/EXPERIMENT/DESIGN/LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR/LIBRARY_STRATEGY , from EGA/SRA 1.2 metadata

column.name: features
column.description: The known features/experimental conditions about the Chip-Seq Input experiment

column.name: feature
column.description: The feature name

column.name: value
column.description: The value assigned to this feature

column.name: units
column.description: The units of the value assigned to this feature

column.name: experiment_type
column.description: Type of experiment: 'Histone H3K4me1','Histone H3K4me3','Histone H3K9me3','Histone H3K9ac','Histone H3K27me3', 'Histone H3K36me3', etc...
column.annotation: It corresponds with IHEC Level 0 EXPERIMENT_TYPE (Chip-Seq)

column.name: library_strategy
column.description: The library strategy, from the point of view of EGA/SRA
column.annotation: It corresponds with /EXPERIMENT_SET/EXPERIMENT/DESIGN/LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR/LIBRARY_STRATEGY , from EGA/SRA 1.2 metadata

column.description: The known features/experimental conditions about the Chip-Seq experiment

column.annotation: It corresponds with IHEC Level 0 EXPERIMENT_TYPE (mRNA-seq)

column.name: library_strategy
column.description: The library strategy, from the point of view of EGA/SRA
column.annotation: It corresponds with /EXPERIMENT_SET/EXPERIMENT/DESIGN/LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR/LIBRARY_STRATEGY , from EGA/SRA 1.2 metadata

column.name: library_strategy

column.annotation: It corresponds with /EXPERIMENT_SET/EXPERIMENT/DESIGN/LIBRARY_DESCRIPTOR/LIBRARY_STRATEGY , from EGA/SRA 1.2 metadata

column.description: The known features/experimental conditions about the smRNA-seq experiment

column.name: feature
column.description: The feature name

column.name: value

concept.name: p
concept.fullname: Simple Somatic Mutations - Primary Analysis File
concept.description: Simple Somatic Mutations [ssm] – Primary Analysis File [p]

column.name: data
column.description: The data from the pipeline associated to each one of the samples which share the same chromosomal coordinates and mutation

column.name: analysis_id
column.description: Unique identifier for the analysis performed for a particular set of samples

column.name: analyzed_sample_id
column.description: Unique identifier for the analyzed sample assigned by data provider

column.name: total_read_count
column.description: Total number of raw reads that cover the called mutation

column.name: mutant_allele_read_count
column.description: Total number of raw reads that contain the mutant allele

column.name: quality_score
column.description: Average quality score for the mutation/variation call

column.name: probability
column.description: Probability of the mutation/variation call

column.name: sample_mut_info
column.description: Mutation information specific for this sample (i.e. fields gathered from VCF column INFO)

column.name: mut_data
column.description: Mutation information (i.e. fields gathered from VCF column FORMAT and sample columns)

column.name: mutation_type
column.description: Type of mutation

cv.e: Insertion
Deletion
Single-base substitution
Multiple-base substitution

column.name: mutation_ident
column.description: Information which backs up the identification of the mutation (i.e. from column IDENT from VCF)

column.name: RScode
column.description: RS code from dbSNP which identifies this mutation

column.name: dbSNPBuildID
column.description: The dbSNP Build ID for this RScode

column.name: reference_genome_allele
column.description: Allele in the reference genome. For insertions, use a dash. For all other types of mutations, use forward strand DNA sequence at the reference genome position as specified in chromosome, chromosome_start and chromosome_end

column.name: expressed_allele
column.description: For heterozygous SNPs, the dominant allele as revealed by RNA-seq in the donor sample. When multiple alleles are identified, up to four alleles can be specified, each separated by a comma (no whitespace allowed)

column.name: control_genotype
column.description: Genotype of the control sample. Use a dash for a missing allele.

column.name: sample_genotype
column.description: Genotype of the donor sample. Use a dash for each missing base

column.name: mutated_from_allele
column.description: Allele that is believed to be the original allele in the ancestral cell that was mutated in the donor cell. Use dash for insertions. Mutated allele must be one of the two alleles in the control_genotype

column.name: mutated_to_allele
column.description: The new allele identified in the donor sample that is believed to be the resulting allele of a somatic mutation event. Use dash for deletions. Mutant allele must be one allele and must be one of the alleles defined in sample_genotype

column.name: gene_stable_id
column.description: For annotated gene, use Ensembl gene ID. Otherwise, use assemblyBuild_chr_start_end where assemblyBuild is hg19.

column.name: normalized_expression_level
column.description: Normalized value of expression level if analyzed by microarray platforms

column.name: reference_sample
column.description: ID of the reference analyzed sample if differential expression is measured

column.name: is_annotated
column.description: If it is true, it indicate if the expressed fragment is annotated in GENCODE/Ensembl (i.e. gene_stable_id contains a Ensembl Gene Identifier)

column.name: probeset_id
column.description: ID of the probeset used in microarray if analyzed by microarray platform

column.name: junction_id
column.description: For known exons, use exonID1_exonID2 where exonID1 and exonID2 are Ensembl IDs of the 5' and 3' exons, respectively. For novel or putative exons, use assemblyBuild_exon1chr_exon1end_exon2chr_exon2start where assemblyBuild is hg18 or hg19; exon1chr and exon2chr are the chromosomes of the 5' and 3' exons, respectively; exon1end is the end position of the 5' exon; exon2start is the start position of the 3' exon.

column.name: gene1_stable_id
column.description: Stable ID of the gene containing the 5' exon at the junction. For GENCODE/Ensembl annotated gene, use Ensembl gene ID. For putative and novel gene, use assemblyBuild_chr_start_end where assemblyBuild can be hg18 or hg19.

column.name: gene2_stable_id
column.description: In the case of a fusion gene, provide the Stable ID of the gene containing the 3' exon at the junction. For GENCODE/Ensembl annotated genes, use Ensembl gene ID. For putative and novel genes, use assemblyBuild_chr_start_end where assemblyBuild can be hg18 or hg19.

column.name: exon1_chromosome
column.description: Name of the chromosome containing the 5' exon (#)

column.name: exon1_number_bases
column.description: Number of bases from 5' exon

column.name: exon1_end
column.description: End position of the 5' exon on the chromosome

column.name: exon1_strand
column.description: Chromosome strand of the 5' exon

column.name: exon2_chromosome
column.description: Name of the chromosome containing the 3' exon (#)

column.name: exon2_number_bases
column.description: Number of bases from 3' exon

column.name: exon2_start
column.description: Start position of the 3' exon on the chromosome

column.name: exon2_strand
column.description: Chromsome strand of the 3' exon

column.name: is_fusion_gene
column.description: Indicate if the function is the result of a fusion gene

column.name: is_novel_splice_form
column.description: Indicate if the splice form is novel

column.name: junction_seq
column.description: Provide junction sequence if either is_fusion_gene or is_novel_splice_form is true

column.name: junction_type
column.description: Type of junction

column.name: junction_read_count
column.description: Count of sequencing reads that span across exons

column.name: NSC
column.description: Normalized strand cross-correlation of the analysis (see ENCODE quality metrics)

column.name: RSC
column.description: Relative strand cross-correlation of the analysis (see ENCODE quality metrics)

column.name: protein_dna_interaction_id
column.description: Unique identifier for the protein-DNA interaction

column.name: protein_stable_id
column.description: Stable id of the interacting protein, antibody or protein complex

column.name: log10_pvalue
column.description: -log10(p-value)

column.name: log10_qvalue
column.description: -log10(q-value) , which available for peaks, but not for broad peaks

column.name: idr
column.description: Irreproducible discovery rate

column.name: transcript_affected
column.description: Transcript on the protein-DNA interaction area. Use Ensembl transcript id. Separate multiple transcripts with vertical bars in the form of trasncriptA|trasncriptB|trasncriptC

column.name: regulatory_region_id
column.description: Unique identifier for the identified regulatory region

column.name: z_score
column.description: Combined z-score of the 250bp window for each tag

column.name: methylation_calling_algorithm
column.description: Name of variation calling algorithm and URL to written protocol

column.name: mr_type
column.description: The type of methylated region site

cv.e: Single nucleotide *-lation
CpG dinucleotide
Hyper-methylated region
Hypo-methylated region

column.name: d_lation_type
column.description: Type of DNA *-lation (Methylation, Hydroxy-Methylation, Formylation, etc...)

cv.e: Methylation (cytosine)
Hydroxy-Methylation (cytosine)
Hydroxy-Methylation (uracil)
Formylation (cytosine)
Carboxylation (cytosine)

column.name: methylation
column.description: DNA *-lation beta value (or average methylation) for interrogated site

concept.name: mr
concept.description: DNA *-lation [dlat] - Methylated Region File [mr] for CpGs and hypo/hyper-methylated regions

column.name: beta_value
column.description: DNA *-lation beta value (or average methylation or ) for interrogated site

column.name: n_cpgs
column.description: Number of CpGs in the DMR

column.name: n_sig_cpgs
column.description: Number of significant CpGs in the DMR (z_score > 3 or < -3)

column.name: hyper_role
column.description: Which participant had the hypermethylation role in the comparison?

cv.e: The hyper methylation role was given to participant A
The hyper methylation role was given to participant B

column.name: abs_avg_diff
column.description: Average of absolute methylation difference for the DMR

column.name: rel_avg_diff
column.description: Average of relative methylation difference for the DMR

column.name: cpg_start
column.description: The coordinates of the CpGs used for the calculation of this differentially methylated region
